ext_descriptions.ext_description: An fd_bc_type_simple is an enumeration type that identifies the simple CFD boundary condition at a boundary location.
the inviscid (slip) wall.
the viscous no-slip wall with heat flux.
the viscous no-slip, isothermal wall.
the viscous no-slip wall; special cases are bc wall viscous heat flux and bc - wall viscous isothermal.
the general wall condition; special cases are bc wall inviscid, bc wall viscous, bc wall viscous heat flux, and bc wall viscous isothermal.
the inflow with subsonic normal velocity.
the inflow with supersonic normal velocity same as bc Dirichlet.
the outflow with subsonic normal velocity.
the outflow with supersonic normal velocity same as bc Extrapolate.
the tunnel inlet (subsonic normal velocity).
the tunnel exit (subsonic normal velocity).
the face degenerated to a line.
the face degenerated to a point.
the polar-coordinate singularity line; special case of bc degenerate line where degenerate face is a straight line and flowfield has polar symmetry; ^s is singularity line tangential unit vector.
the axisymmetric wedge; special case of bc degenerate line where degenerate face is a straight line.
An is an enumeration of i-min through k-max.
a vector whose direction is [ +1, 0, 0 ];
a vector whose direction is [0, +1, 0]
a vector whose direction is [0, 0, +1]
a vector whose direction is [ -1, 0, 0]
a vector whose direction is [0,-1, 0]
a vector whose direction is [0, 0, -1 ]

An mbna bc type is a superset of at least two kinds of boundary-condition types. Boundary-condition types identify the equations that should be enforced at a given boundary location. The boundary-condition types are described by mbna bc type. Some members of mbna bc type completely identify the equations to impose, while others identify a general description of the class of boundary-condition equations to impose. The subdivision of mbna bc type is based on function. For simple boundary-conditions, the equations and data are fixed; whereas, for compound boundary-conditions different sets of equations are imposed depending on local conditions at the boundary. mbna bc type is a superset of mbna bc type simple and mbna bc type compound. It identifies the boundary-condition (simple or compound) at a boundary location.
An mbna bc type compound is an enumeration type that identifies the compound boundarycondition at a boundary location.
the condition is unspecified.
the condition is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
An mbna bc type simple is an enumeration type that identifies the simple boundary-condition at a boundary location.
the condition is unspecified.
the condition is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
the arbitrary conditions on Q or Q/n.
the Dirichlet condition on Q vector.
the Neumann condition on Q/n.
the extrapolate Q from interior.
the symmetry plane; face should be coplanar.
An is an enumeration type that identifies the CFD compound boundary condition at a boundary location.
the inflow, arbitrary normal Mach.
the outflow, arbitrary normal Mach.
the farfield inflow/outflow, arbitrary normal Mach test on normal velocity and normal Mach, then perform one of: bc inflow subsonic, bc inflow supersonic, bc outflow subsonic, bc outflow supersonic.
A Riemann 1D data name is an enumeration of standardized Riemann data for 1-D flow.
the postive invariants or characteristics of the linearized inviscid flow equations
the negative invariants or characteristics of the linearized inviscid flow equations
the entropy of the linearized inviscid flow
the 1 direction vorticity of the linearized inviscid flow
the 2 direction vorticity of the linearized inviscid flow
the positive acoustic component of the linearized inviscid flow
the negative acoustic component of the linearized inviscid flow

A Elements_bc is a type of
containing boundary-condition information for a group of elements in an unstructured mesh.
the elements (in an unstructured mesh).

A Fd_bc is a type of
containing boundary-condition information for a single BC surface patch of a CFD zone.
(inherited) a list of boundary-condition data sets. In general, the proper fd bc dataset instance(s) to impose on the BC patch is determined by the value of the type.

A Fd_bc_dataset is a type of
dataset for CFD. Its intended use is for simple boundary condition types, where the equations imposed do not depend on local flow conditions.
Boundary-condition data is separated by equation type into Dirichlet and Neumann conditions. Dirichlet boundary-conditions impose the value of the given variables, whereas Neumann boundary-conditions impose the normal derivative of the given variables.
the boundary-condition type, which gives general information on the boundary condition equations to be enforced.

A Fd_zone_bc is a type of
that is the boundary-condition information pertaining to a zone.
(inherited) the boundary-conditions for a zone, on a patch by patch basis.

A Indexed_elements_bc is a type of
containing boundary-condition information for cells in a structured mesh.
the element indices.

A Indexed_points_bc is a type of
containing boundary-condition information for points in a structured mesh.
a group of indices; by convention the indices refer to vertices.

An Mbna_bc is a type of
that is is boundary-condition information for a single BC surface patch of a zone. A BC patch is the subrange of the face of a zone where a given boundary-condition is applied. The structure contains a boundary-condition type, as well as one or more sets of boundarycondition data that are used to define the boundary-condition equations to be enforced on the BC patch. For most boundary-conditions, a single data set is all that is needed. The structure also contains information describing the normal vector to the BC surface patch.

a list of boundary-condition data sets. In general, the proper bc dataset instance(s) to impose on the BC patch is determined by the value of the type.
For a few boundary-conditions, such as a symmetry plane or polar singularity, the value of the type completely describes the equations to impose, and no instances of bc dataset are needed. For 'simple' boundary-conditions, where a single set of Dirichlet and/or Neumann data is applied a single bc dataset will likely be used (although this is not a requirement). For 'compound' boundary-conditions, where the equations to impose are dependent on local conditions, several instances of bc dataset will likely be used.
a collection of family boundary-condition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

a list of vectors normal to the BC patch pointing into the interior of the zone; the vectors are not required to be unit vectors. By convention the vectors are located at the vertices of the BC patch. The physical-space normal vectors of the BC patch may be described by inward normal list; these are located at vertices, consistent with point range and point list. The value of this attribute need not be specified because it is not always needed to enforce boundary conditions, and the physical-space normals of a BC patch can usually be constructed from the grid. However, there are some situations, such as grid-coordinate singularity lines, where inward normal list becomes a required attribute because the normals cannot be generated from other information.
reference data applicable to the conditions of the BC patch.
the type of the boundary-condition.

the location of the conditions, which are normally either at the cell vertices or on the cell faces. Some boundary-conditions require a normal direction to be specified in order to be properly imposed. A computational-coordinate normal can be derived from point range or point - list by examining redundant index components. Alternatively, this information can be provided directly by inward normal index. For exterior faces of a zone in 3-D, inward normal index takes one of the values given in Table 10.

A Mbna_bc_data is a type of
that is boundary-condition data. By convention all data specified in a given instance of mbna bc data is to be used in the same type of boundary condition equation. The Dirichlet and Neumann conditions in mbna bc dataset use separate mbna bc data structures.

A Mbna_bc_data_global is a type of
that is global boundary-condition data. If a Dirichlet condition consists of a uniform stagnation pressure but with with a nonuniform.

A Mbna_bc_data_local is a type of
that is is local boundary condition data. If a Dirichlet condition consists of a uniform stagnation pressure but with with a nonuniform velocity profile, then the velocity profile can be described by mbna bc data local.

A Mbna_bc_dataset is a type of
Dirichlet or Neumann data for a single set of boundary-condition equations. Its intended use is for simple boundary-condition types, where the equations imposed do not depend on local conditions.
Boundary-condition data is separated by equation type into Dirichlet and Neumann conditions. Dirichlet boundary-conditions impose the value of the given variables, whereas Neumann boundary-conditions impose the normal derivative of the given variables.
the location of local data arrays (if any) provided in mbna Dirichlet bc dataset or mbna Neumann bc dataset; local boundary-condition data may be defined either at vertices or boundary face centers
reference data applicable to the set of boundary-condition data.
the boundary-condition type, which gives general information on the boundarycondition equations to be enforced.

A Mbna_condition is a type of
that represents the concept of conditions or constraints pertinent to to an analysis

A Mbna_Dirichlet_bc_dataset is a type of
that contains Dirichlet boundary condition data.
boundary-condition data for Dirichlet conditions which may be constant over the BC patch or defined locally at each point of the patch.
An Mbna_family is a is an association of set of boundary-condition with a set of geometric elements.
the text that provides further information about the Mbna_family.
the identifier for the Mbna_family.
the family's boundary conditions.
the family's geometric information.

A Mbna_integral_data is a type of
is a description of generic global or integral data that may be associated with a particular zone or an entire database. In contrast to mbna discrete data, integral data is not associated with any specific field location.

A Mbna_neumann_bc_dataset is a type of
that contains Neumann boundary condition data.
boundary-condition data for Neumann conditions which may be constant over the BC patch or defined locally at each point of the patch.

A Mbna_reference_state is a type of
which is a list of geometric or state quantities defined at a common location or condition. Typical reference states associated with CFD calculations are freestream, plenum, stagnation, inlet and exit.

A Mbna_zone_bc is a type of
that is the boundary-condition information for a zone.

the boundary-conditions for a zone, on a patch by patch basis. Boundary-condition information for a single patch is contained in the bc structure. If a zone contains N boundary condition patches, then N separate instances of bc shall be provided in the zone bc entity for the zone.

reference data. Reference data is applicable to all the boundary-condition of the zone. Reference state data is useful for situations where boundary-condition data is not provided, and solvers are free to enforce any appropriate boundary-condition equations. An engine nozzle exit boundary-condition usually imposes a stagnation pressure (or some other stagnation quantity) different from freestream. The nozzle-exit stagnation quantities could be specified by reference data at this level or below in lieu of providing explicit Dirichlet or Neumman data.
